result.execSummary:
The defendant Danielle R Bender was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: With elements and criminal case settlement agreement forms attached.

Case called at 10:41 am [Clerk SH]
Defendant Danielle R Bender in court with Attorney Elizabeth F. Svehlek. DA Susan V. Happ appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
DA Happ submits AMENDED information; Service of Information admitted; reading waived

Constitutional rights given; plea of "Guilty" entered on Counts #1, #2 & #3; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; Court finds the plea has been entered freely, voluntarily, intelligently and accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders JOC entered.

On Counts #1, #2 & #3, the Court withholds sentence, places Defendant on Probation for 2 years, each count, concurrent, with conditions:
--No acts/threats of violence towards any persons
--Continue existing anger management treatment and not discharge herself until recommended by treatment provider
--Not have unsupervised contact with C.A.S. unless approved by DOC
--To undergo any other type of assessment, treatment or counseling as required per Agent
--To obtain/maintain employment and/or education program or combination of the two, per Agent
--To pay costs of $729 ($243 each count)
--To pay $600 DNA Surcharge ($200 each count)
APPLY CASH BOND

Days credit for time already served: 0 days
Recess: 10:58 am
NOH sent to the jail for the defendant//def has been released
* FINANCIAL RECORDS *
Original bond document received from JESO on 8/15/14
Scheduling order
Jury trial on September 29, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Final status/scheduling conference on September 23, 2014 at 10:30 am.
Scheduling Notice

Case recalled at 11:27 am [Clerk SH]
Defendant Danielle R Bender in court with Attorney Elizabeth F. Svehlek. ADA Monica J. Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court reviews earlier hearing for Atty Svehlek, in which $150 cash bond was ordered for Ms. Bender
Atty Svehlek presents arguments regarding bond & last weeks non-appearance
Court reviews multiple occassions in which Ms. Bender failed to appear or was extremely late for hearings
Atty Svehlek indicates that she has no other explanation for late appearances
Court admonishes Ms. Bender regarding attendance record on this case
Upon questioning of the Court, Atty Svehlek indicates that Ms. Bender is unable to post money towards bond
Upon further questioning, Court allows Ms. Bender to attempt to contact her boyfriend regarding posting $50 cash on bond
off-record: 11:40 - 11:42 am
Atty Svehlek informs the Court that Ms. Bender's boyfriend, who she assumes answered the phone, will be able to post $50

Court presents basis and grants request to modify bond and requires a $50 CASH bond with conditions:
-No acts or threats of violence towards any persons 
-No discussion of the facts of the case with CAS, Crystal Katzer, Amber Bottoms or Carmin Smith

Counsel agree matter can be set on trial calendar & that one day will be needed for trial
Court reminds Ms. Bender that she must appear in person at the next two scheduled hearings and keep in touch with her Attorney
Recess: 11:45 am 

NEXT: (1) Schedule FSSC 9/23/14 at 10:30 am - Send notices (2) Schedule JT 9/29/14 at 8:30 am - Send notices

Case called at 8:39 am [Clerk SH]
Defendant Danielle R Bender in court. ADA Monica J. Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court reviews for the record that It is calling the case without the presence of Atty Svehlek, as Ms. Bender indicated that she can not wait until Atty Svehlek appears. Court advises Ms. Bender that she does not have to talk without her counsel present & could wait until Counsel appears.
Upon questioning of the Court, Ms. Bender indicates that she would like to proceed and that she did not appear at last hearing as her mother was sick and she went to visit her. 
Court admonishes Ms. Bender regarding her non-appearance and the importance of this felony case

Court presents basis and requires $150 cash bond with all non-monetary conditions to remain the same and orders Sheriff to take Ms. Bender into custody

Court informs parties that It will hear matter later today if Ms. Svehlek would like to be heard
Status conference on August 14, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Case called at 10:48 am [Clerk SH]
[Reserve Judge Neal Nettesheim presiding for BrIV]
Attorney Elizabeth F. Svehlek in court. ADA Jeffrey Martin Shock appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Svehlek: Client did send text yesterday afternoon and indicated that her daughter is very sick. Do not have confirmation of what illness is or if she was able to find a sitter. If warrant is issued, would request the warrant be stayed and another STC be set early next week if possible
ADA Shock: No objection
Court orders issuance of bench warrant - Body Only and STAYS warrant until 8/14/14 at 8:30 am - If Defendant does not appear at that time; warrant will issue. If Defendant does appear, warrant will be vacated
Court continues bond

NEXT: (1) Schedule STC 8/14/14 at 8:30 am - Send notices
Status conference on August 8, 2014 at 10:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on July 23, 2014 at 10:00 am.
Scheduling Notice

Case called at 8:46 am [Clerk SH]
[Reserve Judge Robert Mawdsley presiding for BrIV]
Defendant Danielle R Bender in court with Attorney Elizabeth F Svehlek.  ADATheresa A Beck appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
 Service of Information admitted; reading waived; maximum penalties recited.
Pleas of "not guilty" entered
Court reminds Defendant that bond and conditions of bond remain in effect as case is pending.

NEXT: (1) DA PTC scheduled for 7/23/14 at 10:00 am - Send notices (2) STC scheduled for 8/8/14 at 10:30 am - Send notices
State's (with cover letter)
Arraignment on June 20, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on June 18, 2014 at 10:40 am.
Scheduling Notice

Case called at 10:56 am 
[Reserve Judge Robert Mawdsley presiding for BrIV]
Defendant Danielle R Bender in court with Attorney Elizabeth F Svehlek. ADA Theresa A Beck appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Court examines the Defendant as to rights, understanding & intent.  
Ms. Bender waives her right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds her over for Arraignment.
State files information--service of Information admitted, reading waived
Parties request to adjourn arraignment
Court continues bond

NEXT: (1) DA PTC scheduled for 6/18/14 at 10:40 am - Send notices (2) Schedule Arraignment 6/20/14 at 8:30 am - Send notices

Case called at 8:39 am [Case was scheduled for preliminary hearing]
[Reserve Judge Robert Mawdsley presiding for BrIV]
Attorney Elizabeth F Svehlek in court. ADA Theresa A Beck appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Svehlek: Ms. Bender resides in Watertown, she does not have a vehicle or drivers license. Started receiving text messages from Ms. Bender early this morning, indicating that her ride was no longer available. Requests her appearance be excused at this time and reset the matter for 10:45 or 11:00 am today as she does have alternate transportation but they can not be available until later today. Will be a waiver of preliminary hearing.
ADA Beck requests warrant and hold it until later this morning
Court presents basis and informs parties that It will reschedule for waiver of preliminary hearing at 11:00 am today
Recess: 8:41 am 

NEXT:  Waiver of Prelim scheduled for May 30, 2014 at 11:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on May 30, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Scheduling notice

Case called at 3:19 pm 
[Judge Jennifer Weston presiding for BrIV]
Attorney Elizabeth F Svehlek in court. DA Susan V Happ appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court reviews off-record discussion in which Atty Svehlek indicated that Ms. Bender called Counsel and informed her that she was running about 15 minutes late, but now 45 minutes late.
DA Happ requests warrant
Atty Svehlek: Requests matter be stayed until EOB Monday 
Court presents basis and orders issuance of bench warrant - Body Only
Recess: 3:20 pm Reconvene: 3:21 pm  Ms. Danielle Bender now appears
Court quashes warrant
Atty Svehlek: Request STC in approx. 30 days - have instructed client to obtain treatment
Court admonishes Ms. Bender regarding her late appearance and provides constructive warning about appearing on time for all future hearings
Recess: 3:23 pm 

NEXT: (1) Schedule Preliminary Hearing 5/30/14 at 8:30 am - Send notices
Status conference on May 2, 2014 at 02:30 pm.
Pre-trial conference on April 16, 2014 at 10:20 am.
Scheduling Notice

Case called at 9:45 am [Case was scheduled for initial appearance]
[Reserve Judge Daniel Klossner presiding for BrIV]
Defendant Danielle R Bender in court. ADA Jeffrey M. Shock appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Upon questioning of the Court, Ms. Bender indicates that she will be retaining counsel
Right to counsel given; constructive waiver of counsel warnings given. 

Court requires a $500 signature bond, with conditions:

-No discussion of the facts of the case with CAS, Crystal Katzer, Amber Bottoms or Carmin Smith
